poem:
**A Morning's News**

In the hush of morning coffee,  
a page flips—a pardon whispers  
across time zones and lines:  
a brisk nod to tangled vines  
of power and plight.  
New Orleans stirs with its own  
tale of vigilance—a city  
embroidered by tides, now  
intrigued by headlines,  
a transient ripple in  
our daily tea.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump’s homeland security department announces New Orleans immigration operation – live 5.05pm GMT Trump pardons Democratic congressman in federal bribery case Donald Trump announced today that he is pardoning representative Henry Cuellar, the House Democrat who is facing federal bribery and conspiracy charges alongside his wife, Imelda. In a post on Truth Social, the president said the couple would receive a “full and unconditional” pardon. He also called the case against Cuellar – in which". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
